meanings.sent1: I will sell my old toys at the garage sale.
meanings.sent2: She sells handmade jewelry at the craft fair.
meanings.sent3: Trying to sell ice to an Eskimo would be pointless.
meanings.sent4: His charisma could sell sand in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's pitch was so convincing, I had to buy what he was selling.

meanings.definition: To persuade someone to buy something
meanings.sent1: The enthusiastic salesman managed to sell me a vacuum cleaner I didn't need.
meanings.sent2: He sells the benefits of exercise to his clients.
meanings.sent3: She could sell sunscreen to a vampire with her persuasive skills.
meanings.sent4: Her words could sell hope to the hopeless.
meanings.sent5: The infomercial was so convincing, I almost bought what they were selling.

meanings.sent1: The house sold quickly after being on the market for only a week.
meanings.sent2: The new video game sold out within hours of its release.
meanings.sent3: The idea of selling happiness is intriguing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could sell a million dreams.
meanings.sent5: The limited edition sneakers sold like hotcakes.
